results.title: Metformin Promotes Axon Regeneration after Spinal Cord Injury through Inhibiting Oxidative Stress and Stabilizing Microtubule
results.text_hl: Thus, seeking for valid drugs that are beneficial to promoting axonal regrowth and elongation after @DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D013119 @@@SCI@@@ has gained wide attention. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, a @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@-lowering agent, has been demonstrated to play roles in various @<m>DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@central nervous system (CNS) disorders@@@.

results.title: Repurposing metformin to treat age-related neurodegenerative disorders and ischemic stroke.
results.text_hl: Considering @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@'s beneficial preclinical actions on various disorders, and the drug's role in alleviating severity of these conditions through involvement in commonly characterized cellular pathways, we discuss the potential of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ as a suitable drug candidate for repurposing in @<m>DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@CNS disorders@@@.

results.title: Metformin Inhibits NLR Family Pyrin Domain Containing 3 (NLRP)-Relevant Neuroinflammation via an Adenosine-5'-Monophosphate-Activated Protein Kinase (AMPK)-Dependent Pathway to Alleviate Early Brain Injury After Subarachnoid Hemorrhage in Mice
results.text_hl: Previous studies have shown that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ exerts anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ effects and promotes functional recovery in various @<m>DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@central nervous system diseases@@@.

results.title: Metformin promotes Schwann cell remyelination, preserves neural tissue and improves functional recovery after spinal cord injury.
results.text_hl: Considering this, @DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D013119 @@@SCI@@@ treatment and pathology study are urgently needed. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, a widely used hypoglycemic drug, has been indicated for its important role in @<m>DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@central nervous system diseases@@@.

results.title: Ameliorative potential of metformin in LPS and glutamate-induced neurotoxicity in N2a cell-line.
results.text_hl: These findings imply that due to the anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@, diminishing reactive oxidative species, and antioxidant properties of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, it can be considered a therapeutic drug candidate for treating and managing @DISEASE_Neurologic_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D009461 @@@neurological disorders@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@CNS complications@@@ associated with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008659 @@@metabolic abnormalities@@@.

results.title: Metformin attenuates sevoflurane-induced neurogenesis damage and cognitive impairment: involvement of the Nrf2/G6PD pathway.
results.text_hl: Our findings suggested that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could reduce @CHEMICAL_Sevoflurane @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077149 @@@sevoflurane@@@-induced @DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Neurogenic @DISEASE_MESH:D001750 @@@neurogenesis damage@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@neurocognitive defects@@@ in the developing @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ brain by influencing the @GENE_NFE2L2 @GENE_83619 @@@Nrf2@@@/@GENE_G6PD @GENE_24377 @@@G6PD@@@ signaling pathways.

results.title: Metformin ameliorates the age-related changes of d-galactose administration in ovariectomized mice.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@) has been shown to have pleiotropic effects such as neuroprotective, antioxidant, and anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ properties making that a potential candidate for the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@central nervous system (CNS) disorders@@@.
